materials.raw_text: Cd: 10 g, Ce: 2.5 g, Co: 10 g, Tb: 20 g, Tm: 15 g

sourcing.instructions: Cd: Chemical supply companies, Ce: Rare earth suppliers, Co: Metal suppliers, Tb: Specialty alloy providers, Tm: Rare earth metal suppliers
steps: Cd: Chemical supply companies, Ce: Rare earth suppliers, Co: Metal suppliers, Tb: Specialty alloy providers, Tm: Rare earth metal suppliers

1. Weigh out 10 g of Cadmium (Cd), 2.5 g of Cerium (Ce), 10 g of Cobalt (Co), 20 g of Terbium (Tb), and 15 g of Thulium (Tm). 2. Combine the weighed materials in a clean, dry glass container. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly with a non-reactive spatula to ensure an even distribution of materials.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 10 g of Cadmium (Cd), 2.5 g of Cerium (Ce), 10 g of Cobalt (Co), 20 g of Terbium (Tb), and 15 g of Thulium (Tm). 2. Combine the weighed materials in a clean, dry glass container. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly with a non-reactive spatula to ensure an even distribution of materials.

steps: 1. Transfer the combined mixture to a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and set the temperature to 1200°C. 3. Hold the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the combined mixture to a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace and set the temperature to 1200°C. 3. Hold the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Do not remove the crucible until the furnace reaches ambient conditions; this should take approximately 4-6 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Do not remove the crucible until the furnace reaches ambient conditions; this should take approximately 4-6 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges or surfaces. 3. If required, seal the surface with a clear protective coating to enhance durability and appearance.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges or surfaces. 3. If required, seal the surface with a clear protective coating to enhance durability and appearance.
